alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 1:51PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW LIKELY THROUGH THE WEEKEND... A complex area of low pressure moving toward the region from the Gulf of Alaska will bring accumulating snow to the eastern Kenai Peninsula, mainly from Portage Valley to Moose Pass, for the weekend. An initial round of light snow showers will develop Saturday morning and could taper off briefly Saturday evening through Saturday night before a second round of heavier snow develops Sunday morning. Heaviest snowfall rates will likely be Sunday morning with light snow continuing through the day before tapering off Sunday night. Although there is still uncertainty in the exact track and timing of this system, 4 to 8 inches of snow is likely from Girdwood to Whittier and along the Seward Highway from Portage Valley to Summit Lake, with locally higher amounts possible. 3 to 6 inches of snow is likely for Moose Pass with lesser amounts south to Seward. Visibility may also be reduced at times Sunday morning due to the combination of potentially higher snowfall rates and resuspended snow from vehicular traffic. For the latest forecast, visit www.weather.gov/afc
